section.title: Demonstration 1 Main Page

content.text: The Asset Query contains a complete set of information available for a given asset and its betterments. It reflects the current status of the asset and provides a history of the activity processed against the asset record. This query is used to research information regarding the asset or betterment. This query has the following three sections: Summary, Detail, and Accounting Line. Each section contains more detail that is specific to the asset record being viewed, and groups the asset record with its associated betterments. In the demonstration, you can see what the query looks like and how to use it.

section.title: Copy of Demonstration 1 Main Page

content.text: To begin the Asset Query, click Queries, Fixed Assets and then Asset Query.

content.text: Click on the radio button next to the Asset you would like to display

The Asset Query page displays an overall summary of the asset and all of its betterments. It is created by Fixed Asset Acquisition (FA) transactions. The Fixed Asset Betterment (FB), the Fixed Asset Correction (FC), the Fixed Asset Transfer (FT), as well as purchasing and payment transactions may also update certain fields on the summary record.
Click the Details button to view the Asset Query Details page.

The Asset Query Details page provides information specific to the original asset and its betterments. An asset summary record is created at the time the original asset is acquired (i.e., when the fixed asset acquisition document is processed.)
The Actual Acquisition Cost displays an amount that is the sum of the acquisition cost of the asset and associated betterments.
The Details tab shows the original asset and any associated betterments. Asset, accounting and spending details can be viewed for each of the asset or betterment records listed in the Details window.
To view the details for a selected asset or betterment, click on the radio button.

Several links will appear, including the Asset Detail, Accounting Detail, and Spending Details. Once you select one of these links. They will appear as tabs. The Asset Query Details and Details tabs will then appear as links.
The Asset Depreciation History page appears
Click the Asset Fiscal Year Depreciation tab
The Asset Fiscal Year Depreciation page appears
